Package com.lopl.melody.settings.items

Class MusicPlayerProvider

java.lang.Object
com.lopl.melody.settings.Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
com.lopl.melody.settings.items.MusicPlayerProvider
public class MusicPlayerProvider
extends Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
This class controls what music platform should be used to search for tracks, playlists and more. Currently supported platforms are Youtube and Spotify. Spotify requires a working API key. This may be implemented free to use in the future. The data holder of this Setting is MusicPlayerProvider.Value.

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultValue

      @NotNull protected @NotNull MusicPlayerProvider.Value getDefaultValue()
      This returns the initial SettingValue. It will be set as the current value for the setting in the constructor. It returns the YouTube state of the data holder, as Melody should can search on YouTube without any key or account.
      Specified by:
      getDefaultValue in class Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
      Returns:
      MusicPlayerProvider.Value.youtube()

    • getPossibilities

      public java.util.List<MusicPlayerProvider.Value> getPossibilities()
      This returns all possible values for the setting. Possible are 2 states : youtube, spotify
      Specified by:
      getPossibilities in class Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
      Returns:
      a list (Nonnull and not Empty) containing all values of SettingValue

    • updateData

      public void updateData​(int data)
      This is called whenever a new data wants to be applied. this will set the state to the new value and if the state is illegal, it will be set to the default state.
      Specified by:
      updateData in class Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
      Parameters:
      data - a int containing the value representation

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Description copied from class: Setting
      Returns the displayed Setting name. Can be set in the constructor with Setting.name. Or you can override this method.
      Overrides:
      getName in class Setting<MusicPlayerProvider.Value>
      Returns:
      The displayed Setting name.
